com.ibm.team.scm.client.content

Interface IVersionedContentManager


  • public interface IVersionedContentManager
    Methods for storing and retrieving versionable contents from the repository. The content manager is closely tied to its ITeamRepository, and only works when the client is logged in to the repository.

    Items can have content attributes (e.g. attributes that store large amounts of data) by specifying of type of the attribute as IVersionedContent. The content is then stored in the repository in a two-stage process.

    • Stage 1: upload the content bytes. Upon successful receiving and storing the uploaded content, the server puts the content on a pending list until it is claimed.
    • Stage 2: store the item state embedding the reference to the content by id. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operation fails if the content service does not have it. To fetch the content:
    • Stage 1: fetch the item with the content attribute and retrieve the IVersionedContent instance from the item. This content description contains the identifier that can be used by the server to identify the contents associated with this attribute.
    • Stage 2: download the contents using retrieveContent(IVersionableHandle, IVersionedContent, OutputStream, IProgressMonitor) using the content description from stage 1.

    Since:
    0.7

    • Method Detail

      • teamRepository

        ITeamRepository teamRepository()
        Returns the repository associated with this manager. The client need not be logged in to the repository.
        Returns:
        the repository, which is never null

      • storeContent

        IVersionedContent storeContent(AbstractVersionedContentManagerInputStreamProvider streamProvider,
                             ContentHash predecessorHintHash,
                             org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws TeamRepositoryException
        Uploads the contents to the server. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IVersionedContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference. The server checks the embedded references to ensure that the content service really has content with that id. The com.ibm.team.scm.client.IWorkspaceConnection#commit(IChangeSetHandle, Collection) operation fails if the content cannot be claimed.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        streamProvider - the input stream provider from which to read the bytes to send to the server. Must not be null.
        predecessorHintHash - the predecessor of the current content, i.e. the content it is derived from. null if none or unknown.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        the content identifier for the uploaded bytes
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation fails because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • retrieveContent

        void retrieveContent(IVersionableHandle item,
                   IVersionedContent content,
                   java.io.OutputStream outStream,
                   org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                     throws TeamRepositoryException
        Downloads the bytes specified by the content handle and writes them to the specified output stream. The output stream is closed before the method returns. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IVersionedContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference.

        Since the content length is supplied by the server, a TeamRepositoryException will thrown if both length values do not match. A hash mismatch will also result in a TeamRepositoryException.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        item - A state handle identifying the item state that contains the supplied content
        content - the content that identified the bytes to download. The content object must be exactly as retrieved from the server, and must not have been modified. Modification of any fields of an IVersionedContent object before retrieving the content stream may result in unpredictable behavior.
        outStream - the output stream into which the downloaded bytes are written; this stream will be closed on any return from this method, normal or exception.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • retrieveContentStream

        java.io.InputStream retrieveContentStream(IVersionableHandle item,
                                        IVersionedContent content,
                                        org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                          throws TeamRepositoryException
        Sets up a download connection to the server to retrieve the content bytes, and returns an input stream to be used to read the content. Uploaded content must first be claimed before it can be retrieved from the server. Claiming of uploaded content is done by embedding the reference to the content IVersionedContent within an item and then saving the item to the server with this new content reference.

        This method should be used with caution by client code. An HTTP connection remains open to the server until the client closes the returned input stream. Clients calling this method should immediately retrieve all content from the stream, and close it as quickly as possible.

        The operation has the following preconditions:

        • The client is logged in to the repository.
        The operation fails by throwing TeamRepositoryException if any of its preconditions are not met.

        Parameters:
        item - A state handle identifying the item state that contains the supplied content
        content - the content that identified the bytes to download. The content object must be exactly as retrieved from the server, and must not have been modified. Modification of any fields of an IVersionedContent object before retrieving the content stream may result in unpredictable behavior.
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        Returns:
        an input stream from which the content bytes can be read by client code.
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getUnclaimedContentCleanupPeriod

        long getUnclaimedContentCleanupPeriod(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                      throws TeamRepositoryException
        Returns the cleanup period for unclaimed content in seconds. This is the minimum length of time that unclaimed content will be kept on the server
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException

      • deleteContent

        void deleteContent(ContentHash hash,
                 boolean force,
                 org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                   throws TeamRepositoryException
        Deletes the specified content in the repository. The given content must exist in the repository.
        Parameters:
        hash - The hash of the content to delete
        monitor - a progress monitor, or null if progress reporting is not desired
        force - When false, delete will fail with VersionedContentClaimedByMultipleItems if more than 1 item claims the content. When true, delete will not check how many items claim the content.
        Throws:
        NotLoggedInException - if the operation failed because the client was not logged in to the repository
        TeamRepositoryException - if the operation fails for any other reason
        org.eclipse.core.runtime.OperationCanceledException - if the operation is canceled. Cancellation can occur even if no progress monitor is provided.

      • getContentStatus

        com.ibm.team.scm.common.ContentStatusResponse[] getContentStatus(IVersionableHandle[] v,
                                                               ContentHash[] h,
                                                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                                 throws TeamRepositoryException
        Retrieves the content statuses for the specified contents. The versionable and content hash arrays must be of the same length, where for each content hash h[i], the corresponding versionable state handle v[i] is the source of the content.
        Parameters:
        v - the versionable handles (with state ids) owning the corresponding content. A member may be null if the corresponding content was uploaded by the client
        h - the hashes of the contents for which to get the statuses.
        Returns:
        The statuses for the corresponding content, where return[i] is the status for h[i]
        Throws:
        TeamRepositoryException
